bibl.title: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Henry Rose Carter, March 5, 1919

div1.p: Gorgas writes that he is preparing to travel to Guayaquil. He is uncertain of his plans for the next year.

div1.head: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Henry Rose Carter, March 5, 1919
div1.opener:
Gorgas
Y. F
Washington, D.C.
March 5th, 1919
My dear Carter;
div1.p:
Yours of March 2nd is acknowledged.
We are all in the midst of packing, getting ready
for our Guayaquil trip. Mrs. Gorgas, Lyster,
Wrightson and I expect to sail on the 18th from
New York.

Our plans for this years work are
more or less vague as our appropriation is not very
extensive. I hope though sometime during the year
to get into Mexico. I would like very much to have
you in this work with me though at present I have
nothing definite for your consideration.

I am sorry to have missed Laura.
Mrs. Gorgas joins me in kindest regards.
